label: AB3C_mC60_15_af_e4f_ef-001
title: $\alpha$-SrIrO$_{3}$ Perovskite Structure
comments:
The structural transitions in SrIrO$_{3}$ are less certain than for other perovskites. \begin{itemize} \item The ground state is usually believed to be \href{current_web_home_dir/AB3C_mC60_15_af_e4f_ef-001}{monoclinic with space group $C2/c$ \#15} (this structure), however \item (Schmalle, 1990) found a somewhat disordered room temperature \href{current_web_home_dir/A2B6C7_cI90_204_e_dg_ac2f-001}{cubic phase}. \item (Longo, 1971) found that to the right of a line from (700$^\circ$C, 5\,GPa) to (1650$^\circ$, 2\,GPa) there is a transformation to the \href{current_web_home_dir/AB3C_oP20_62_c_cd_a-001}{orthorhombic CaTiO$_{3}$ structure}, but \item (Wang, 2024) found a \href{current_web_home_dir/AB3C_tP10_123_g_abi_cd-001}{tetragonal double perovskite structure} formed at 1400$^\circ$C and 6\,GPa, well into the range where (Longo, 1971) found the orthorhombic structure. This structure is very close to \href{current_web_home_dir/AB3C_cP5_221_a_c_b-001}{cubic perovskite ($E2_{1}$)}, which may well be the structure found at higher pressures and temperatures. \end{itemize} ~ \vspace{-0.25in} 
 The Greek letters used to designate the phase are arbitrarily assigned in the order of the first publication describing the phases. 
 We give the similar compounds in the order ABC$_{3}$, where the ``A'' atoms are on the (4a)/(8f) sites, the ``B'' atoms on the (4e)/(8f) sites, and the ``C'' atoms on the (4e)/(8f)$^{4}$ sites. 
 We list quaternary compounds having this structure under the \href{current_web_home_dir/A3BC2D9_mC60_15_ef_a_f_e4f-001}{Ba$_{3}$CoIr$_{2}$O$_{9}$} prototype.
